title: ‘I’m Gonna Say It Now’ Review: Troubadour and Troublemaker
sub_head: The legacy of Phil Ochs’s folk-music rebellion lives on in words that still spark fires.
body:
Late in his short life, Phil Ochs, one of the shining lights of the Greenwich Village folk protest movement, worried whether his songs would be remembered. The news from four decades on is good.
Neil Young, who recently recorded Ochs’s classic “Changes,” called him “one of the greatest songwriters who ever lived.” Eddie Vedder repurposed 1965’s “Here’s to The State of Mississippi” as a critique of George W. Bush, while at the 2016 Democratic National Convention, Lady Gaga unexpectedly delivered an impassioned version of “The...
